Yup, applying the proposed changes.
The most recent Jenkins result failed only in `testE2EWordCount` for the Apex runner, so I believe this PR is good to merge as-is.
Love negative diffs. LGTM.

This change only adds support for empty flags for `ValueProvider<String>`. Are we meant to support the same set of valid empty fields for all supported non value provider types (`String`, `enum`, `String[]`, `enum[]`, `Collection<String>`, `Collection<enum>`) with this change?

Yes, right now I was only going for String (as one of the template example is blocked on it).  
Created a jira, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1137, will handle is this in a follow up PR.
cc: @sammcveety

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/5771/
--none--
Addressed all comments here, but because of desire to include more motivating tests, superseded by #1581

Still will want to have tests for:
`ValueProvider<TestEnum>` and empty strings are supported
`ValueProvider<TestEnum>` and non empty string are supported
`Collection<TestEnum>` and empty strings are supported
`Collection<TestEnum>` and non-empty strings are supported

`ValueProvider<Collection<Integer>>` and empty strings are unsupported
`ValueProvider<Integer[]>` and empty strings are unsupported
`ValueProvider<TestEnum[]>` and empty strings are unsupported

Is BEAM-1317 planned to go in following this one almost immediately?

R: @tweise

It is true that all sources should be easily serializable by most common mechanisms - they are user functions just like `DoFn` etc. So I think this is an improvement anyhow, and I guess this just hasn't been exercised because other runners do not wrap the source at translation time.

The serialization test passes in the DirectRunner Module locally.
I was able to reproduce some connection errors locally by repeatedly running the test. Looking.
integrated changes

I don't think we dropped the ball. GitHub mirroring / automation messed up something.

I think @sammcveety should just close.

Confirmed the fix for just the error in question manually, since Jenkins is severely backlogged.

```
mvn -DskipTests clean install -P apex-runner -pl examples/java -am

mvn --errors failsafe:integration-test@apex-runner-integration-tests \
    -pl examples/java \
    -P apex-runner \
    -P jenkins-precommit \
    -D test=WordCountIT \
    -D beamTestPipelineOptions='[
      "--runner=org.apache.beam.runners.apex.TestApexRunner",
      "--project=...",
      "--tempRoot=..."
    ]'
```

(deliberately trying to sprinkle knowledge and record of these incantations here and there)

R: @davorbonaci
@davorbonaci There is currently no hard specification as to how objects need to be serialized. Kryo proliferation comes from runners relying on Kryo as their defacto serialization mechanism.
But Spark, for example, serializes sources and coders using java serialization as is expected today by Beam.
LGTM. Ready for merging (modulo test runs).
LGTM. Ready for merging (modulo test runs).
I'm going to look at it tonight. I believe Java serialization can be used for this reference in the runner also.

Thanks @tweise! Agree that we should hold off on a quick fix, then, if you think you can just avoid the whole issue. It will save us debating the relationship of Kryo and Beam :-)
@tgroh seemed to have reduced scope of the change. With that, LGTM. Good for self-merge.

We can potentially improve it later to. Generally, if the class is Java serializable, then use

`@Bind(JavaSerializer.class)`

in the Apex operator code.
